alert.note: Alert for Dauphin; Juniata; Northumberland; Perry; Snyder (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:13PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN NORTHUMBERLAND... NORTHERN DAUPHIN...NORTHEASTERN JUNIATA...SOUTHEASTERN SNYDER AND NORTHEASTERN PERRY COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 612 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Selinsgrove to 16 miles south of Sunbury to 21 miles south of Mifflinburg. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Millersburg, Lykens, Elizabethville, Williamstown, Port Trevorton, Meiserville, Urban, Liverpool, Wiconisco, Gratz, Dalmatia, Berrysburg, Herndon, Pillow and Enders. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
